Submodules

chatbot.controllers module

class chatbot.controllers.TrainingController(dataset: CornellDialogsDataset, hyperparameters: Dict[str, Any], checkpoints_dir: str, resume: bool = False)

Bases: object

Controls the flow of the training process of a seq-to-seq conversational model with PyTorch.

The entire process in high-level includes:

- Initialization of encoder and decoder layers
- Setting up encoder and decoder optimizers
- Splitting data into validation and training sets
- Creation of dataloaders
- Start training process
Parameters:

  • dataset (CornellDialogsDataset) – The cornell dialogs dataset.

  • hyperparameters (Dict[str, Any]) – Set of hyperparameters.

  • checkpoints_dir (str) – Directory to save checkpoints.

  • resume (optional, bool) – If True, resumes training from a saved checkpoint. Defaults to False.

dataset

The cornell dialogs dataset.

Type:

CornellDialogsDataset

hyperparameters

Set of hyperparameters.

Type:

Dict[str, Any]

checkpoints_dir

Directory to save checkpoints.

Type:

str

resume

If True, resumes training from a saved checkpoint.

Type:

bool

vectorizer

Class responsible for converting tokens to numbers.

Type:

SequenceVectorizer

mask_index

Index of the mask token in the vocabulary.

Type:

int

Example

>>> # Create a `Dataset` object from the dataset's txt file
>>> # and with a `split()` tokenizer
>>> from chatbot.datasets import CornellDialogsDataset
>>> from chatbot.utils.aux import get_tokenizer
>>> split_tokenizer = get_tokenizer(tokenizer=None) # If None returns split()
>>> dataset = CornellDialogsDataset.load_pairs_and_vectorizer(
...     file="./cornel_dialogs.txt",
...     tokenizer=split_tokenizer,
...     min_count=3,
...     max_length=10
... )
>>>
>>> # Define training hyperparameters in the following format:
>>> # Note that the hyperparameters are defined in a yaml file
>>> # but with the same format.
>>> hyperparameters = {
...     "general": {
...         "num_epochs": 10,
...         "batch_size": 64,
...         "lr_patience": 3,
...         "lr_reduce_factor": 0.25,
...         "ea_patience": 7,
...         "ea_delta": 0.005,
...         "clip_factor": 50,
...         "max_seq_length": 10,
...         "min_count": 3
...     },
...     "model_init_params": {
...         "alignment_method": "dot",
...         "embedding_dim": 50,
...         "hidden_size": 50,
...         "dropout": 0.1,
...         "encoder_num_layers": 1,
...         "decoder_num_layers": 1,
...         "teacher_forcing_ration": 0
...     },
...     "optimizer_init_params": {
...         "encoder_lr": 0.0001,
...         "decoder_lr": 0.0001
...     }
... }
>>>
>>> # Initialize the training controller
>>> training_controller = TrainingController(
...     dataset=dataset,
...     hyperparameters=hyperparameters,
...     checkpoints_dir="./checkpoints/"
... )
>>>
>>> # Start training process
>>> trainer = training_controller.prepare_for_training()
>>> training_controller.start_training(trainer=trainer)
prepare_for_training() → Trainer

Defines the layers of the seq-to-seq model, i.e., the embedding, encoder, and decoder layers. #TODO

start_training(trainer: Trainer) → None

Splits the dataset into training and validation sets, creates dataloaders and begins the training process.

chatbot.datasets module

class chatbot.datasets.CornellDialogsDataset(sequence_pairs: List[List[str]], vectorizer: SequenceVectorizer)

Bases: Dataset

get_num_batches(batch_size: int) → int

Given a batch size, returns the number of batches in the dataset.

Parameters:

batch_size (int) – The batch size.

Returns:

The number of batches in the dataset.

Return type:

int

get_vectorizer() → SequenceVectorizer

Returns the vectorizer.

classmethod load_pairs_and_vectorizer(file: str, tokenizer: Callable[[str], List[str]], max_length: int = 10, min_count: int = 3) → CornellDialogsDataset

Initializes the CornelDialogsDataset from a .txt file.

Parameters:

  • file (str) – Path to the .txt file.

  • (Callable[[str] (tokenizer) – Tokenizer for splitting each sequence before vectorization.

  • List[str]] – Tokenizer for splitting each sequence before vectorization.

  • max_length (int, optional) – Maximum number of tokens allowed in each of the pair sequence (default=10).

  • min_count (int, optional) – Minimum token count value threshold (default=3).

Returns:

An instance of CornelDialogsDataset.

Return type:

CornelDialogsDataset

Module contents

The project implements a global logger which is initialized in the main package.

The logger redirects the log messages to both the console.

Example of using logger:
>>> from chatbot import logger
>>> logger.info("info message")
>>> logger.debug("debug message")
>>> logger.error("error message")
